newsitem.title: USA: Chicago Mayor picks former judge to head law dept.
newsitem.headline: Chicago Mayor picks former judge to head law dept.

text.p: Chicago Mayor Richard Daley chose a former state judge as corporation counsel for the city's Law Department.
Brian Crowe, 58, served on the Cook County Circuit Court and is a current member of the Chicago police board that investigates misconduct.
Crowe is a name partner in the Chicago law firm of Rock, Fusco, Reynolds, Crowe & Garvey which includes former Illinois Senate President Phil Rock.
The selection of Crowe, which is expected to be announced formally Tuesday, was confirmed by his office.
Crowe will replace former Corporation Counsel Susan Sher, who left the department about three months ago to become general counsel for the University of Chicago Hospitals.
